alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Carroll; Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:10AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Maryland, including the following counties, Baltimore, Carroll, Howard and Montgomery and northern Virginia, including the following counties, Fairfax and Loudoun. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 310 AM EST, Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in tonight`s event. - Rainfall has ended for the most part tonight. However, flooding is ongoing at several spots in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia... Germantown... Rockville... Bethesda... Gaithersburg... Olney... Elkridge... Damascus... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Poolesville... Historic Ellicott City... Ellicott City... Aspen Hill... Potomac... North Bethesda... Ashburn... Catonsville... Woodlawn... Randallstown... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
